ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to define in a central place and by means of keys all the various Tax Rates which could be applicable in your bank on any type of transaction that the Customer is doing with you or which will apply on interest paid to or received from the Customer. The Tax Rate defined for each key will then determine the amount of Tax to be added to or subtracted from the amount to be given or received by the Customer.
In its present version, the Tax Rate will always be applied in a "FLAT" way, i.e. tax calculations which are based on a "TIME" factor are not presently available.

It is also possible to indicate whether tax is to be credited to the tax account in local currency or in the currency of the deal on which it is being applied. If this field is left blank then tax will be credited in the currency in which it is calculated. All currency conversion will use the mid rate applicable at the time of the calculation.
Tax debited to the customer will still be posted in the currency in which it is calculated, it is only the credit to the tax account which will be posted in local cuurency.

desc.p: Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

The tax calculation operator specifies whether the amount of Tax calculated is to be added to or subtracted from the amount to be given or received by the customer. The information in this field is only used in the calculation of Tax on Interest and Charges on Customers' Accounts, it is not used in the Funds Transfer, Loans or Money Market Applications.
M (minus) or P (plus). (Mandatory input. Cannot be changed)
If the tax is used for debit interest set up then TAX.OPERAND should be PLUS
Examples: 1) Assume Credit Interest of 100 and a Tax Rate of 15%.
a) Assume Tax Operator P (plus). (net interest rate quoted to the customer)
b) Assume Tax Operator M (minus). (gross interest rate quoted to the customer)
2) Assume a charge of 100. Tax Operator must be P (plus).
Specifies the rate used to calculate the tax in a band for an entry as a Percentage of its value.
Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point, (standard rate format.) but must be less than 100%. Associated sub-value field.
Rate input must be positive and less than 100%.
Not more than 3 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.
Mutually exclusive with the RATE field.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

This field associated with the field CURRENCY may be used when interest, commission, charges etc on which this tax is applicable are required to be rounded. The type specified in this field along with the value in the associated field BASE. ROUND. UNIT would be used to round the base amount for tax calculation.
The Types that may be used are:
1.NATURAL 2.LOWER 3.HIGHER
Natural
Natural-rounding rules will be applied depending upon the rounding unit.
E.g. If rounding unit is 10 and interest/ commission calculated is 246 then commission is rounded off to 250 for calculation of tax.
Lower
Always rounded off to the next lowest rounding unit
E.g. if rounding unit is 10 and interest/commission calculated is 246 then commission is rounded off to 240 for calculation of tax.
Higher
Always rounded off to the next highest rounding unit.
E.g.. If rounding unit is 10 and interest/commission calculated is 246 then commission is rounded off to 250 for calculation of tax.
HIGHER, LOWER or NATURAL or any abbreviation thereof.
Optional input
This field is mandatory if BASE. ROUND. UNIT is entered.

This is a multi value field associated with the field BASE. ROUND. TYPE. The unit to which interest, commission, charges Etc (on which this tax is to be applied) is to be rounded, could be specified here.
E.g.
Optional Input
Input to this field is numeric & is mandatory if BASE. ROUND. TYPE has value.
The no of decimals if any, in this value should be less than or equal to the no of decimals indicated in CURRENCY. PARAM file for the currency entered.
Specifies any user-defined routine that is called for Tax calculation. The calculated tax amount is returned by this routine.
Input to this field is Optional.
To specify a user defined routine, it should be prefixed with '@'. The routine should have a PGM.FILE entry defined, of Type = 'S'.

The routine should accept the following parameters : ( PASS.CUSTOMER, PASS.DEAL.AMOUNT, PASS.DEAL.CCY, PASS.CCY.MKT, PASS.CROSS.RATE, PASS.CROSS.CCY, PASS.DWN.CCY, PASS.DATA, PASS.CUST.CDN,R.TAX,TAX.AMOUNT )
Where PASS.CUSTOMER: The customer number for whom the tax is calculated.
PASS.DEAL.AMOUNT: The deal amount used for calculations.
PASS.DEAL.CCY: The currency of the deal amount.
PASS.CCY.MKT: The market to use for currency conversions.
PASS.CROSS.RATE: The cross rate that need to be used.
PASS.CROSS.CCY: The other currency used in transaction.
PASS.DWN.CCY: The currency to return the tax amount in.
PASS.DATA: It contains all charges and tax details.
PASS.CUST.CDN: It contains the customer condition.
R.TAX: It is the array having the Tax record.
TAX.AMOUNT: It contains the calculated tax amount.

Note: PASS.CUSTOMER, PASS.DEAL.AMOUNT, PASS.DEAL.CCY, PASS.CCY.MKT, PASS.CROSS.RATE, PASS.CROSS.CCY, PASS.DWN.CCY, PASS.DATA, PASS.CUST.CDN and R.TAX are Input parameters. TAX.AMOUNT is the Output parameter.
The method of calculation to be used for the associated currency.
This field specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each band of the base amount, whether only one is calculated which is dependent on the level of the base amount.
Example:
Assume a deal of Principal 100,000 USD where tax is calculated based on the Principal. The tax record specifies an applicable rate of 2 per cent up to 10,000 and 1.5 percent over 10,000.
If Band is specified for all sub value groups, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e. 2% on 10,000 1.5% on 90,000
If Level is specified for all sub value groups, 1 calculation will be performed, ie. 1.5% on 100,000
A change can be made in one band to the next from BAND to FLAT but not vice versa
LEVEL or BAND or any abbreviation thereof.
Mandatory if banded taxes are specified.
No input if a flat RATE has been specified.
The field specifies the currency that the banding in this multi value is to be applied to.
It must be an existing code on the CURRENCY Table.
Identifies the Category code of the Tax Account to be credited with the calculated Tax.
4 or 5 numeric character Category code. Multivalue field associated with Fields 3-7. (Mandatory input)
It must be a valid code on the CATEGORY table in the range 10000 - 19999.
Where more than one type or rate of Tax is applicable, multivalue Fields 3-7 may be used to specify these. A separate calculation will be made for each.

The tax liability internal account will then be generated by the System as follows: CCY CATEG NNNN where CCY = Currency of tax account CATEG = Category code defined in this field NNNN = Sequential number. '1' will always be generated in this case.
Specifies the currency of the associated banded tax specifications.
Multi-valued field associated with CALC.TYPE, BANDED.RATE, UPTO.AMT, MINIMUN.AMT, MAXIMUM.AMT, OVERALL.MIN.AMT and OVERALL.MAX.AMT.

If a specific currency is not represented within the multivalue set, the System will default to the details associated to the DEFAULT.CCY. The currency equivalent amount will be derived at the currency table MID.REVAL.RATE.
3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1-3 numeric characters Currency Code.
The currency code entered must appear on the Currency table.
Mandatory input for banded tax specification.
No input if a flat RATE is specified.
CURRENCY.MARKET

Identifies from which currency market the system will have to fetch the conversion rates in the CURRENCY application, for any Tax conversion. The CURRENCY table allows you to identify, if required , up to nine different sets of exchange rates.
If this CURRENCY.MARKET is assigned a value, then the MID.REVAL.RATE of that CURRENCY.MARKET will be used for Tax conversion. If this field is blank then the deal currency market will be used.
2 numeric characters. Must be a valid currency market from the CURRENCY.MARKET table
Input is optional
The definition of the currency which is to be used as the default for calculation of the tax where banded taxes are specified.

If a specific currency is not represented within the banded tax multivalue set, T24 will default to the details associated to the DEFAULT.CCY. The currency equivalent amount will be derived at the currency table MID.REVAL.RATE.
3 type SSS (uppercase alpha) character or 1-3 numeric character Currency code.
Mandatory input if banded taxes are specified
Must be defined in the field CURRENCY.
No input if a flat RATE is specified.
Describes the Tax Charge, and can be used for reporting.

This field can be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the Tax type in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description must be entered.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
LINK.TAX

This field holds a link to another existing tax record on the tax file and will form the basis of the 'Tax on Tax' processing. The entry must be a valid TAX record already and must not be linked to another TAX record in the whole chain. This means you can have an unlimited 'Tax on taxes', just not the same ones.
Defines the Maximum Amount to be charged on this tax range.

The Maximum Amount should never be greater than the maximum calculated amount within the range. When there are various ranges within the same Currency, the amount must be equal or greater than the preceding Maximum Amount. It must also be greater than the associated Minimum Amount.
Up to 14 AMT type characters (standard amount format). Associated sub-value field.
Defines the Minimum Amount to be charged on this tax range.
When there are various ranges within the same Currency, the Minimum Amount must be equal or greater than the preceding Minimum Amount. It must also be less than the associated Maximum Amount.
Up to 14 AMT type characters (standard amount format). Associated sub-value field.

Defines the Overall Maximum Amount to be charged on tax involving the Currency defined. This amount represents the maximum to be charged irrespective of any special conditions which could exist for a Customer or group of Customers except if these have been specified as a Flat amount.
This amount could represent the maximum amount the bank would ever conceivably charge a customer for a transfer regardless of the size of the Transfer Amount.
Up to 14 AMT type characters (standard amount format). Associated multivalue field. (Optional input.)
It must be greater than the Overall Minimum Amount.
It must be greater or equal to the last Maximum Amount specified within a range for the Currency.

Defines the Overall Minimum Amount to be charged on tax involving the Currency defined. This represents the minimum to be charged irrespective of any special conditions which could exist for a Customer or group of Customers except if these have been specified as a Flat amount.
This amount could represent the actual cost to the bank of providing the service, which should never be waived.
Up to 14 AMT type characters (standard amount format). Associated multivalue field. (Optional input.)
It must be less than the Overall Maximum Amount.
It must be less than or equal to the first Minimum Amount specified within a range for the currency.
Specifies the Rate used to calculate the amount of Tax applicable.

Special care should be taken by the user when the Interest Rates quoted to the Customer are "Net of Taxes". If this is the way you quote credit interest rate to your customers, the tax rate entered into this field must then be "GROSSED UP" to allow the System to calculate the correct Tax amount and the NET amount of interest.
Example:

Let us suppose that the Tax Rate applicable on credit interest is equal to 20%. If a customer is offered 10% for a month deposit, the net Interest Rate for the Customer will be 8%. If this is the Rate quoted (Net rate i.e. 8%), a Tax ID must then be defined in this table with a Tax Rate of "25%" to enable the correct calculation of the Tax amount.
Note: The formula to calulate the grossed up Rate is:
1-10 type R (Standard Rate Format upto 6 integer and 9 decimal) numeric characters.
Not more than 6 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.
Can not be input if banded taxes are specified.
This is a valid record in EB.ROUNDING.RULE e.g. TAX.DOWN, TAX.UP
It is used for Tax calculation if the tax record used is linked to another tax record, i.e the LINK.TAX field is set.
Note: Tax on commission and charges do not use this field for rounding.
It may be left blank or a Valid Id to EB.ROUNDING.RULE may be input.
ROUNDING.TYPE
This is a multivalue field associated with the CURRENCY field to specify the rounding type for rounding the tax amount.
Rounding type can be : 1.NATURAL 2.LOWER 3.HIGHER
Higher
Always rounded of to the next highest rounding unit
E.g.. If rounding unit is 10 and commission calculated is 246 then commission is rounded of to 250
Lower
Always rounded of to the next lowest rounding unit
E.g. If rounding unit is 10 and commission calculated is 246 then commission is rounded of to 240
Natural
Natural-rounding rules will be applied depending upon the rounding unit
E.g. If rounding unit is 10 and commission calculated is 246 then commission is rounded of to 250
HIGHER, LOWER or NATURAL or any abbreviation thereof.
Optional input
This field is mandatory if rounding unit is entered
ROUNDING.UNIT
This multivalue field is to mention the unit to which the tax amount should be rounded based on currency.
E.g.
Optional Input
Input to this field is numeric & is mandatory if rounding type has value.
The no of decimals if any, in this value should be less than or equal to the no of decimals indicated in CURRENCY.PARAM file for the currency entered.
This is the key to the Tax record which is composed of a 2 numeric Tax code and an effective date.
Note: Altering an existing Tax record does not cause any adjustment to charges already processed.

a) 1-2 numeric characters Tax code (Mandatory input). b) '.' (Mandatory input if date is input, otherwise optional). c) Up to 9 type D characters (Standard Date Format in range 1950 - 2049). (Optional input. The date will be defaulted to the Run date if it has not been entered.) The date entered cannot be smaller than the RUN date.
Provides a Short Description of the Tax charge and can be used for reporting.

This field can be expanded to allow the user to enter the Short Description of the Tax type in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description must be entered.
3-16 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
Reserved for future use.
TAX.BASE

This field can contain either TAX or EVENT. If TAX is chosen it will indicate that the above linked tax id is to be calculated as a tax on tax. If EVENT is chosen it will indicate that the tax linked to above is a tax on an event.
MANDATORY INPUT if linked to another tax record
Specifies whether tax amounts are to be recorded for reporting purposes.

When raising tax entries to the local authority account the information required for reporting purposes will be recorded in the NARRATIVE field on the STMT.ENTRY. This information will include the following information: - Customer number debited/Customer on which charges are based for Funds Transfer. - Deal amount on which tax was calculated - Deal currency - Tax code - Tax rate - Exchange rate used
All other required information will be available from the standard fields on the STMT.ENTRY i.e. tax amount in local currency, value date, booking date and transaction reference.
Y(ES) Tax amounts are to be recorded. (Optional input. No default.)
This field gives an user the option of which exchange rate, held on the currency table, to use when converting the tax from foreign currency to local currency.
There is a functionality where in rate specified in this field is used to convert to local equivalent of the tax amount. This functionality is developed for GWHT and applicable only for link tax.
A maximum of 10 characters may be entered.
The following values are permitted: MIDREVAL BUY SELL REVAL
Specifies whether tax is to be reported in local currency.
The tax entries which are produced will be in local currency if this flag is set to 'YES', independent of the currency of the underlying deal.
Y(ES) Tax is to be reported in local ccy. (Optional input. No default.)
Identifies the Transaction Code to be assigned to Credit entries generated as a result of Tax calculations.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Multivalue field associated with Fields 3-7. (Mandatory input)
It must be a valid code on the TRANSACTION table.
The Debit Credit Indicator in the Transaction record must be CREDIT.
Where more than one type or rate of Tax is applicable, multivalue Fields 3-7 may be used to specify these. A separate calculation will be made for each.
Identifies the Transaction Code to be assigned to debit entries generated as a result of Tax calculations.

Note: When tax is calculate on charges on a Foreign Exchange contract, only one debit entry is generated, including both the charge and the tax amount and using the transaction code from the FT.CHARGE.TYPE or FT.COMMISSION.TYPE table.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Multivalue field associated with Fields 3-7. (Mandatory input)
It must be a valid code on the TRANSACTION table.
The Debit Credit Indicator in the Transaction record must be DEBIT.
Where more than one type or rate of Tax is applicable, multivalue Fields 3-7 may be used to specify these. A separate calculation will be made for each.
Specifies if the tax account number to be credited is the same tax account for all postings, or a different account for each transaction.
The tax account number is constructed in the format CCY ccccc nnnn where:
CCY is the currency of the transaction, or the local currency (depending on the TAX.IN.LOCAL field)
Ccccc is the 5 digit CATEGORY code.
Nnnn is a 4 digit suffix, either fixed as 0001 if this field is not set to Y, or a random number formatted with leading zeroes if this field is set to Y.

In high volume environments where tax is taken on many transactions it may be desirable to set this field to Y for performance reasons. When this field is not set each transaction involving tax will be posted to the same account (the suffix will be 0001), as a result locking situations may be encountered whilst the other transactions complete. Setting this field will allocate a different tax account per transaction by using a different suffix generated as random number thereby avoiding the locking situation.
The random number is by default between 1 and 20, but can be increased by setting the field MAX.TAX.SUFFIX in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER.
Optional input
Possible value Y
UPDATE.POOL.SEQ
This field will indicate which tax pool will be used through the German tax processing.
UPDATE.POOL.SEQ

An entry in this field will indicate whether this tax is to be processed through POOL.1 or POOL.2. If POOL.2 chosen then also POOL.1 will be used when the amount of POOL.2 in CUST.INT.BALANCES is not sufficient.
Defines the Maximum Amount to be charged on transfers to which this tax range applies.

The Maximum Amount should never be greater than the maximum calculated amount within the range. When there are various ranges within the same Currency, the amount must be equal or greater than the preceding Maximum Amount. It must also be greater than the associated Minimum Amount.
Up to 14 AMT type characters (standard amount format). Associated sub-value field.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a multi valued field.
Contains details of any override applicable to this record.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.
